Specialization of {{lc|std::formatter}} that defines formatting rules for a {{lc|std::chrono::local_time}}.

@1@ If {{tt|%Z}}, {{tt|%z}} or a modified variant of {{tt|%z}} is used, a {{lc|std::format_error}} is thrown.

@2-4@ The {{tt|local_time_format}} function returns a value of unspecified type that holds the local time, offset, and time zone abbreviation.&lt;br&gt;
When an object {{tt|f}} of this unspecified type is formatted, if {{tt|%Z}} is used, it is replaced with {{c|*f.abbrev}} widened to {{tt|CharT}} if {{c|f.abbrev}} is not null; otherwise a {{lc|std::format_error}} is thrown. If {{tt|%z}} or a modified variant thereof is used, an offset of {{c|*f.offset_sec}} will be formatted if {{c|f.offset_sec}} is not null; otherwise a {{lc|std::format_error}} is thrown.

{{lc|std::formatter}} is usually not directly accessed, but is used through [[cpp/utility/format|formatting functions]].
